citations.narrative:
The walls of the off display primary enclosure pool for the three pinnipeds have multiple rusted areas that have formed
holes with sharp points and edges. There are also several areas with chipped and peeling paint. Primary enclosures
housing marine mammals must not have any sharp projections and/or edges which may cause injury or trauma to the
marine mammals contained therein. Rusted areas are also difficult to clean and sanitize which could cause contamination
and disease transmission to the enclosed animals. Maintenance problems must be identified and fixed in a timely manner
to keep the facilities in good repair and protect the animals from injury.
Correct by 10-13-2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative at the State Fair in Tulsa, Oklahoma.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
